medicines.what: Reduces uric acid levels in your blood
medicines.with: Drink lots of water to avoid kidney damage
medicines.call: Skin rash, Yellowing of skin/eyes, High temp, Sore throat, Swollen glands

medicines.what: Protects you from getting viral infections
medicines.with: Usually taken 2-5 times per day, with or without food
medicines.call: Skin rash, Wheezing, Tightness in chest or throat, Trouble breathing

medicines.what: A steroid that reduces nausea, vomitting and swelling
medicines.with: Take after food otherwise you risk damaging your stomach
medicines.call: High Temperature or chills, Very upset stomach, Sleepy or confused

medicines.what: Protects you from getting bacterial infections
medicines.with: can be taken as a tablet or intravenously
medicines.call: Bruise or bleed easily, Skin rash, High temp

medicines.what: A chemotherapy used to kill cancer cells
medicines.with: Ideally take tablet form on an empty stomach
medicines.call: Severe diarrhoea, tightness in chest, difficulty breathing

medicines.with: Usually in the form of one tablet per day

medicines.what: Prevents blood clots forming by thinning the blood
medicines.with: Usually adminstered as a daily injection
medicines.call: Painful rash, heavy nose bleeds, severe headaches
